verse.lines: {lang-eng}What has stripped the seeming beauty From the idols of the earth? Not a sense of right or duty, But the sight of peerless worth.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
v5
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Who extinguishes their taper Till they hail the rising sun? Who discards the garb of winter Till the summer has begun?{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: {lang-eng}’Tis that look that melted Peter, ’Tis that face that Stephen saw, ’Tis that heart that wept with Mary, Can alone from idols draw:{/lang-eng}
